snippet: Chinese consumers were taking to the Internet in record numbers for an annual 24-hour online sale that has ballooned into the world’s biggest e-commerce event.
abstract: Chinese consumers take to the Internet in record numbers for annual 24-hour online sale on Nov 11 that has ballooned from so-called Singles' Day into world’s biggest e-commerce event; Internet shopping giant Alibaba processes more than $5.75 billion in online payments and reports 402 million unique visitors to its sites; one-day sale heralds frenetic growth of Internet shopping in China, which is set to become largest online shopping market in the world.

byline.original: By SHANSHAN WANG and ERIC PFANNER
byline.contributor: Shanshan Wang reported from Hangzhou, China, and Eric Pfanner from Tokyo. Didi Kirsten Tatlow contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Chinese consumers were taking to the Internet in record numbers for an annual 24-hour online sale that has ballooned into the world’s biggest e-commerce event.

headline.main: China’s One-Day Shopping Spree Sets Record in Online Sales
headline.print_headline: Chinese Spree Sets the Record In Online Sales
